channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Abandoned vehicle not removed, 17th February
item.description:
Notice affixed to windscreen dated 29.01.26 gives x 7 days to remove. The vehicle is still there and has clearly been abandoned. Vehicle is at the end of Eastcote Road at the junction with Ashmore Grove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastcote Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Abandoned motorbikes, 17th February
item.description:
For over a year 3 motorbikes have been abandoned and chained to a lamppost. I have reported this several times and the bikes remain. Bexley and Peabody are disputing who owns the land where the bikes have been left. These are a danger and an eyesore
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Yarnton Way, Lower Belvedere, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Littering being thrown into the steer from the garden, 17th February
item.description:
Numerous items of litter, food packaging etc have been thrown over the garden wall into the street from 122 Redriff Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Redriff Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: At the junction between Princess Road and Regents Park Road, 17th February
item.description:
Speed bump cracking up. I reported this at the end of last year and some temporary repairs were made. However, things are now deteriorating further, with the granite setts getting loose and the tarmac breaking up, particularly just to the north of the speed bump. The damage might have been exacerbated by a water pipe burst at the end of last year, a little further to the north, which ran for two or three weeks before Thames Water fixed it. Silt was running down the gutter (some is still there) and water percolating through the tarmac in places.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Princess Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path way is a disgrace, 17th February
item.description:
This is the fly tipping tree that has regular rubbish dumped around it. There are numerous wheelie bins overloaded with carpet and other rubbish. The length of Glenister Road leading into Armitage Road are an absolute disgrace. I suggest if a camera can be fitted somewhere around this tree to catch whoever keeps on making our area look like a overall tip. I for one cannot stand this area, it has long gone down hill, I have lived here 50 years and it has become a huge disgrace and is embarrassing when we have visitors. It is also a novelty if we ever see a road sweeper.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Caletock Way, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Fly tipped furniture

item.title: At the NE side of junction between Princess Road and Chalcot Road, 17th February
item.description:
One of the granite lintels forming part of the speed bump has started rocking and a piece has broken off. Things are likely to get worse rapidly if it is not fixed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 66, Chalcot Road, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Selective parking enforcement, 17th February
item.description:
Ongoing selective parking enforcement in this location. A particular vehicle is parked in a 30-minute short-stay bay for extended periods every day without any enforcement action, while other vehicles in the same bays are issued PCNs and penalised. This inconsistent approach undermines public trust and prevents fair access to short-stay parking for residents, customers, and legitimate users. Please investigate why this specific vehicle is being repeatedly ignored, provide a clear explanation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Plough Way, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Animal foul outside my front door, 17th February
item.description:
There is animal foul outside my front door everyday. I remove the mess myself and when I get back home from work it's there again and sometimes in the morning when I leave for work.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Dagmar Road, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
